result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rafael Adam Rodriguez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez in court.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court for Rafael Adam Rodriguez.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense requests additional time for review. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Manually added due to system error.

Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez not in court, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court for Rafael Adam Rodriguez.  Attorney Jennifer Jean Tate in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced for hearing. Case adjourned in Branch 4.
Arraignment scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Filed: Original Transcript of Initial Appearance ( 24 pages) commencing 04-21-2022 by Jennifer L. Carter.

Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez in custody at Oshkosh Correctional.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafael Adam Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney.    
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #18CF5842. Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Harms. State rests.  Defense rests. Defense motions to dismiss Count 3 due to lack of proof of injury. Motion is denied. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy and waived reading. Defense requests an arraignment. Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Arraignment scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for status of counsel.  Court placed on the record, findings of fact and finds good cause to extrend time limits of prelim. Case adjourned in Prelim court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez not in court, defendant in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a motion hearing.  Defendant filed a motion for prompt disposition.  Defendant was not produced.  Court finds defendant failed to comply with statutory requirements and motion is ineffective.  Status conference scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Thomas Reed in court on behalf of public defender's office.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Reed advises court regarding appointment. Court finds good cause for extention of prelim time limits. Court inquires of the state regarding prompt dispo filing. State advises of information regarding prompt dispo filing. Court orders state to provide information regarding the filing of the prompt dispo. Court further orders person who receives prompt dispo to testify regarding information. Court set motion hearing in Branch 4.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Motion for Bond Reduction ( Rafael Rodriguez - # 449304 Oshkosh Correctional Institution 1730 W Snell Rd, Oshkosh, WI 54901)

Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez in court, in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. Defendant appears without counsel. SPD has not appointed counsel at this time. State requests an Order to Show cause hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE to Br 4.  Order to show cause hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant's Petition for Waiver of Fees and Costs of Indigency. 

Copied to Judge Hanrahan's case per discussion with Judge Hanrahan and Judge Watts.

Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing rescheduled to 10:30 am on 05/02/2022.  All parties notified.

Court ordered no contact with R.D.C; R.S.T. and P.S-G.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez in court with attorney Matt W Kline.  Defendant Rafael Adam Rodriguez in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rafael Adam Rodriguez appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense challenges to dismiss counts 3-5 due to lack of probable cause. State argues, Court order the state to amend counts 3-4. Court orders count 5 to be dismissed without prejudice due to lack of evidence. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense. A sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4). DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant's Motion for Prompt Disposition.  (Rafael A. Rodriguez - #449304, Oshkosh Correctional Institution, PO Box 3310, Oshkosh WI 53903-3310).

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
K-Warrant
